text:
It's the day after a massive turkey dinner
I'm looking at you Turkey Dude, how is there
still so much of you left?

I need to do something with this turkey, this
is the best turkey I've ever cooked turkey

club sandwich, been there done that, turkey
bubble and squeak, did that too...ultimate
turkey chowder, yeah.

This is a super simple recipe fry up some
roughly chopped garlic and onions and some

finely slice bacon until dark soft and sticky
I like to add the garlic halfway through so

it doesn't overcook then add some roughly
chopped red pepper Cajun pepper sweet smoked

paprika and a solid pinch of salt and black
pepper whilst that's frying I'm gonna get

out my leftover roast turkey and veg I'm gonna
pop my turkey slices and veg into the processor

I'm then going to add my stock and blitz lightly,
I don't wanna mush it I just want to break

it down into smaller pieces this is perfect
life couldn't get and better after you've

blitzed it you can then heat it on the hob
but I'm using a steam blender to do the job

all in one go I'm ten minutes away from being
back on the sofa taking in a good movie and

chowing down on the best leftover meal ever
add your fried ingredients along with some

corn off the cob all the while steaming your
chowder add a swig of single cream to thicken

and add smoothness then season to taste that's
it folks things couldn't get any better so

I'm ready to dish up now I'll pour it out
into four bowls and serve with crispy smoked

bacon and a sprinkling of cheese time for
the taste test delicious creating something

this good shouldn't be this easy but it is
rich smooth and spicy chowder Guys I implore

you to try this recipe at home and share your
pictures with the hashtag #LOVEYOURKITCHEN

and if you want to see how to cook the ultimate
turkey click on the link on the bottom left

corner of the screen and if you wanna see
the behind the scenes stuff all the crazy

stupid hilarity there's a button down there
to check out that action, I'm gonna have a
sit down I'll see you guys next time!
